00161     public: virtual inline void setPacketType (PacketType t) {
00162       if (t != PacketType_Context) {
00163         throw VRTException("Can not change packet type to non-Context type when using BasicContextPacket");
00164       }
00165       BasicVRTPacket::setPacketType(t);
00166     }

00186     // XXX - overriding public: virtual bool BasicVRTPacket::isChangePacket () const
00187     //       since that is hard-coded to return true (valid for Data packets), but here we get that
00188     //       value from inline bool IndicatorFieldProvider::isChangePacket() const;
00189     public: virtual bool isChangePacket() const {
00190       return IndicatorFieldProvider::isChangePacket();
00191     }

00206     // FIXME - this is probably incorrect. The spec says timestamp adjustment applies
00207     //         to the timestamp of each associated data packet, and NOT to the timestamp
00208     //         of the context packet. That means this function is impossible to ever
00209     //         return valid without access to a DataPacket and ContextPacket together.
00210     //         See Section 9.7.3.1 of V49.2 draft spec
00211     public: TimeStamp getAdjustedTimeStamp () const {
00212       int64_t adj = getTimeStampAdjustment();
00213       return (adj == INT64_NULL)? getTimeStamp() : getTimeStamp().addPicoSeconds(adj);
00214     }

00317     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField0 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00318       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00319       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength());
00320     }
00321     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField1 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00322       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00323       if (!isCIF1Enable()) return 0;
00324       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4);
00325     }
00326     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField2 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00327       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00328       if (!isCIF2Enable()) return 0;
00329       int32_t off = 0;
00330       if (isCIF1Enable()) off+=4;
00331       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4+off);
00332     }
00333     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField3 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00334       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00335       if (!isCIF3Enable()) return 0;
00336       int32_t off = 0;
00337       if (isCIF1Enable()) off+=4;
00338       if (isCIF2Enable()) off+=4;
00339       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4+off);
00340     }
00341     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField7 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00342       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00343       if (!isCIF7Enable()) return 0;
00344       int32_t off = 0;
00345       if (isCIF1Enable()) off+=4;
00346       if (isCIF2Enable()) off+=4;
00347       if (isCIF3Enable()) off+=4;
00348       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4+off);
00349     }

00389     protected: inline Geolocation getGeolocation (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field, int32_t cif7bit) const {
00390       int32_t off = getOffset(cifNum, field, cif7bit);
00391       Geolocation val;
00392       if (off >= 0) unpackPayloadRecord(off,val);
00393       return val;
00394     }

00398       int32_t off = getOffset(cifNum, field, cif7bit);
00399       Ephemeris val;
00400       if (off >= 0) unpackPayloadRecord(off,val);

00413     public: inline GeoSentences getGeoSentences (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const {
00414       int32_t cif7bit = (getCIFNumber(cif7field) != 7) ? 0 : getCIFBitMask(cif7field);
00415       int32_t off = getOffset(0, protected_CIF0::GPS_ASCII_mask, cif7bit);
00416       GeoSentences val;
00417       if (off >= 0) unpackPayloadRecord(off,val);
00418       return val;
00419     }

00429       int32_t off = getOffset(0, protected_CIF0::CONTEXT_ASOC_mask, cif7bit);
00430       ContextAssocLists val;

00501 
00510     public: virtual PayloadFormat getDataPayloadFormat (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const {
00511       // INT64_NULL (0x8000000000000000) is actually a valid PayloadFormat bit arrangement, so we
00512       // can't use the normal isNull(bits) check. This isn't an issue in Java where null is
00513       // not equal to a legal 64-bit integer value.
00514       int32_t cif7bit = (getCIFNumber(cif7field) != 7) ? 0 : getCIFBitMask(cif7field);
00515       int32_t off = getOffset(0, protected_CIF0::DATA_FORMAT_mask, cif7bit);
00516       return (off < 0)? PayloadFormat() // NULL
00517                       : PayloadFormat(getX(0, protected_CIF0::DATA_FORMAT_mask, cif7bit));
00518     }
00519
